content: I agree that Zulip has some pretty bad UI design. but discord's deficiencies are worse IMO -- the UI is superficially better, but some deeper things are broken. like, when scrolling the backlog I have to idea how to figure out the day of the message I am looking at. or, email notifications are just not working -- I disabled them once by accident, it is impossible to enable them again. or, private messages are in a totally different place than channels. or, managing which channels of a "server" you care for is a mess. or, there's no good way to browse where I was @mentioned when I come back after a few weeks, the "mentions" list only goes back 2 weeks or so. I could go on.

anyway, sorry for the rant.^^
IMO it doesnt really matter which chat the libs team is on, as long as there is one^^ I thought their IRC isnt used any more?
@simulacrum Could we create a new topic for the Zulip UX discussion? :slight_smile:
I think we can do so in #zulip there's no need for a stream
@simulacrum I'm not sure I understand? I mean pulling the discussion about Zulip out of the discussion about the libs team and into its own topic. Not creating a new stream.
Oh yeah for sure. I think you can do it? I'm on my phone right now
Hm, actually, I think moving cross stream isn't possible
But a new topic should be
@simulacrum Unfortunately not, otherwise I would have just done it. :stuck_out_tongue: cant-edit.png
Huh I thought we had that permission enabled
I'll get around to it in a bit when I get to my computer
(forked this from #general > libs team meetings and btree)
I can't remember exactly how we've got that set up - I'm fairly sure you're only able to fork a conversation at one of your own messages, I'm not sure if the 1 hour edit window applies to that.
Yes, I definitely can edit my own message's topic. The time limit does not apply.
I wonder though -- if users can only edit the topic of their own message, can they not then select the "all later messages" or whatever?
at that point it seems... almost useless :)
@simulacrum I can select that option. I just can't edit another persons topic at all. edit-options.png
There's a setting to enable changing the topics of anyone's messages.
Yes I specifically meant that editing the topic of your own message if you can't edit others doesn't seem useful
Well it can also go wrong. I meant to move only my messages to a different topic and ended up moving everyone's messages. It created a lot of confusion because it was a really long thread
